meanings.definition: More informal or colloquial in style or language
meanings.sent1: The slangier words in the conversation made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: Her speech became slangier as she relaxed with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's attempt to sound slangier ended up confusing the students.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere at the party grew slangier as the night went on.
meanings.sent5: The slangier tone of the book made it more relatable to young readers.

meanings.definition: Using more slang or informal language than usual
meanings.sent1: The slangier expressions in the text added a touch of humor.
meanings.sent2: He became slangier when talking to his buddies from school.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow sounded even slangier than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her slangier choice of words painted a vivid picture of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The slangier phrases made the song catchy and memorable.
